snippet: The Commerce Ministry in Beijing reported the longest run of falling growth in foreign direct investment since the 2008-9 global financial crisis.
abstract: China reports the longest run of falling growth in foreign direct investment since the 2008-9 global financial crisis; investment was $66.7 billion between January and July, down 3.6 billion from year-ago period; country aims to expand total trade by an average of 10 percent in 2012, but shipments have been volatile so far.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Ministry in Beijing reported the longest run of falling growth in foreign direct investment since the 2008-9 global financial crisis.

headline.seo: Trade Expected to Worsen for China
headline.main: Foreign Investment Fading, China Expects Trade to Slow
headline.print_headline: Foreign Investment Fading, China Expects Trade to Slow
